overview: This bill is an act relating to custodial interference. [1] It amends Section 707-726, Hawaii Revised Statutes, concerning custodial interference in the first degree. [1] The measure includes in the crime of custodial interference in the first degree the taking, enticing, concealing, or detaining of a minor from a person who has a right to custody pursuant to a Voluntary Establishment of Paternity. [1]

policy_impact: This measure amends Section 707-726, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to include in the offense of custodial interference in the first degree the taking of a minor from a person who has a right to custody pursuant to a voluntary establishment of paternity. [1] The bill defines "voluntary establishment of paternity" as the signing of the minor's birth certificate and filing a voluntary establishment of paternity form with the birthing hospital or department of health. [1] This Act does not affect rights and duties that matured, penalties that were incurred, and proceedings that were begun before its effective date. [1]
